conclusion: Analyze the v-t graph to determine the ratio of accelerations during deceleration phases.
Deceleration phase for particle A is between t = t0 and t = 3t0.
Deceleration phase for particle B is between t = 5t0 and t = 6t0.
Initial velocity for particle A at t = t0 is 2v0.
Final velocity for particle A at t = 3t0 is v0.
Change in velocity for particle A is -v0.
Time taken for deceleration for particle A is 2t0.
Magnitude of acceleration for particle A is v0/2t0.
Initial velocity for particle B at t = 5t0 is v0.
Final velocity for particle B at t = 6t0 is 0.
Change in velocity for particle B is -v0.
Time taken for deceleration for particle B is t0.
Magnitude of acceleration for particle B is v0/t0.
Ratio of magnitudes of accelerations for A and B is 1/2.
